edu.stanford.pigir.arcspread

Class POSTagger

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.pigir.arcspread.POSTagger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<java.util.List<java.lang.String>>

    public class POSTagger
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Iterator<java.util.List<java.lang.String>>
    Facility to tag arbitrary text with part-of-speech tags. Special facilities are provided for HTML text. Provides part-of-speech tagging for HTML, and untagged text. Relies on the Stanford Part-of-Speech-Tagger. Four initializers are available to control the behavior of the tagger. The tagging behavior of a POSTagger instance is set once and for all by how it is created. Subsequently, the tag method may be called many times with different texts. Behaviors based on three parameters to the initializer methods:
    • Only generate output for text within a given set of HTML/XML tags.
    • Only generate output for a small number of POS tags, as defined in 'Simplified Part of Speech Tags' below. The normally very fine grained variants of grammatical entities are mapped into simple forms. For example: Noun (NN), and noun singular (NNS) are both tagged with Noun (NN) if this option is true
    • Only generate output for an explicitly provided set of parts of speech tags.
    Full list of POS tags:
    1. CC Coordinating conjunction
    2. CD Cardinal number
    3. DT Determiner
    4. EX Existential there
    5. FW Foreign word
    6. IN Preposition or subordinating conjunction
    7. JJ Adjective
    8. JJR Adjective, comparative
    9. JJS Adjective, superlative
    10. LS List item marker
    11. MD Modal
    12. NN Noun, singular or mass
    13. NNS Noun, plural
    14. NNP Proper noun, singular
    15. NNPS Proper noun, plural
    16. PDT Predeterminer
    17. POS Possessive ending
    18. PRP Personal pronoun
    19. PRP$ Possessive pronoun
    20. RB Adverb
    21. RBR Adverb, comparative
    22. RBS Adverb, superlative
    23. RP Particle
    24. SYM Symbol
    25. TO to
    26. UH Interjection
    27. VB Verb, base form
    28. VBD Verb, past tense
    29. VBG Verb, gerund or present participle
    30. VBN Verb, past participle
    31. VBP Verb, non�3rd person singular present
    32. VBZ Verb, 3rd person singular present
    33. WDT Wh�determiner
    34. WP Wh�pronoun
    35. WP$ Possessive wh�pronoun
    36. WRB Wh�adverb
    Simplified Parts of Speech Tags
    • "SVN" --> "NN": Noun
    • "NNS" --> "NN": Noun singluar
    • "NNP" --> "NNP": Proper noun
    • "NNPS" --> "NNP": Proper noun plural
    • "RB" --> "RB": Adverb
    • "RBR" --> "RB": Adverb comparative
    • "RBS" --> "RB": Adverb superlative
    • "JJ" --> "JJ": Adjective
    • "JJR" --> "JJ": Adjective comparative
    • "JJS" --> "JJ": Adjective superlative
    • "IN" --> "IN": Preposition (e.g. 'over')
    • "PRP$" --> "PRP$": Possessive pronoun (e.g. 'my')
    • "VB" --> "VB": Verb base form
    • "VBD" --> "VB": Verb past tense
    • "VBG" --> "VB": Verb gerund or present participle
    • "VBN" --> "VB": Verb past participle
    • "VBP" --> "VB": Verb non-3rd person singular present
    • "VBZ" --> "VB": Verb 3rd person singular present

    • Method Detail

      • tag

        public POSTagger tag()
        All text will be POS-tagged with the simplified POS tags.

      • tag

        public POSTagger tag(java.lang.String htmlTags)
        Only text within provided HTML tags will be POS-tagged, with simplified POS tag set.
        Parameters:
        htmlTags: - Space-separated string of HTML tags. Only text within those HTML tags in content will be POS-tagged. Example: "h1 p". Pass null if inapplicable.

      • tag

        public POSTagger tag(java.lang.String htmlTags,
            boolean simplifiedPOSTags)
        Only text within provided HTML tags will be POS-tagged. The second parameter controls whether only the simplified set of POS-tags should be used.
        Parameters:
        htmlTags: - Space-separated string of HTML tags. Only text within those HTML tags in this tagger's content will be POS-tagged. Example: "h1 p". Pass null if inapplicable.
        simplifiedPOSTags: - Map very granular POS tags into a simplified set. Pass false if full POS tag granularity is wanted.

      • tag

        public POSTagger tag(java.lang.String htmlTags,
            boolean simplifiedPOSTags,
            java.lang.String posTags)
        Full control over all three behaviors.
        Parameters:
        htmlTags: - Space-separated string of HTML tags. Only text within those HTML tags in content will be POS-tagged. Example: "h1 p". Pass null if inapplicable.
        simplifiedPOSTags: - Map very granular POS tags into a simplified set. Pass false if full POS tag granularity is wanted.
        posTagList: - Space-separated list of POS tags to which output is to be limited. Pass null if inapplicable.

      • getAll

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> getAll()
        Obtain all of the result packaged in a HashMap. This Map associates words with a Set of all POS tags that were assigned to that word anywhere in the content. Often this set will just have one POS tag member. But some words might have different tags in different contexts.
